text: The Cora was a digital fire-control system designed by Peter Toth and produced by the Swiss company Contraves. == Development == Peter Toth started the design in 1957, and the system was fielded for anti-aircraft fire direction with the Swiss Army in the 60s.Un ordinateur historique retrouvé dans les caves de l’EPFL , 24 Heures One copy of the system was used at the École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL) for cartography, and was put on display during Expo 64. The unit was rediscovered in storage in 2011, and is now on display at the Musée Bolo, in the Computer Science department of the EPFL. The Musée Bolo met with Peter Toth and released several videos around his work on the Cora. == References == == External links == * Discovery of Two Historical Computers in Switzerland: Zuse Machine M9 and Contraves Cora and Discovery of Unknown Documents on the Early History of Computing at the ETH Archives, Making the History of Computing Relevant , Springer 2013 * Schweizer Transistorrechner für militärische und zivile Zwecke, IT Magazine 2012/01 Category:Military computers Category:Artillery components Category:Artillery operation Category:Applications of control engineering Category:Ballistics Category:Military electronics Category:Computer-related introductions in 1978
